title: China’s Humanoid Bots Were Everywhere at America’s Top Tech Show
snippet: One of Elon Musk’s worries was on full display at CES in Las Vegas this week. Chinese-made human-like robots were everywhere across the exhibition floor, playing table tennis, sweeping floors and practicing kung fu.

title: OpenAI launches a dedicated experience for medical questions in ChatGPT: Here's how it works
snippet: OpenAI has introduced ChatGPT Health, a feature designed to provide personalized health information by integrating users' medical records and wellness apps.

title: Oppo Reno 15 Pro, Reno 15 Pro Mini 5G launched in India: Price, specifications, launch offers and more
snippet: Oppo Reno 15 Pro and Reno 15 Pro Mini have debuted in India with MediaTek Dimensity 450 processor and ColorOS 16 on board.

title: Oppo Reno 15 5G with Snapdragon 7 Gen 4 processor, 6,500mAh battery launched in India: Price, specs and more
snippet: Oppo launched the Reno 15 in India, featuring a Snapdragon 7 Gen 4 processor and ColorOS 16. Priced between  ₹45,999 and  ₹53,999, it will be available from January 13 on multiple platforms.&nbsp;

title: Poco M8 5G with 6.77 inch AMOLED display, 5,520mAh battery launched in India: Price, specs and more
snippet: Poco launched the M8 5G in India with Snapdragon 6 Gen 3, priced from  ₹18,999. It features a 6.77-inch AMOLED display, dual rear cameras, and a 5,520mAh battery.

title: Snowflake CEO on AI, search & more; Razorpay joins IPO queue
snippet: Happy Friday! Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy spoke with ET about the impending overhaul of online search due to AI. This and more in today's ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: Exclusive: Razorpay invites banker pitches for IPO; targets Rs 4,500 crore fundraise
snippet: Razorpay has begun formal preparations for a stock market debut, inviting merchant bankers to pitch for its IPO mandate, people familiar with the matter told ET. The digital payments firm is looking to raise up to Rs 4,500 in fresh capital.

snippet: Sridhar Ramaswamy, who spent 15 years at Google and helmed the tech major’s massive advertising business, said legacy players will find it hard to match the pace of startups such as OpenAI in web searches. title: Elon Musk-led X saw AI media grievances surge post Grok Imagine rollout in India
snippet: Grievances filed with social media platform X in India against synthetic or manipulated media surged to an estimated 983 in September 2025, comprising more than half the total 1,959 complaints it received, up from zero in each of the preceding three months.

title: ET Graphics: AI Summit lays out red carpet for India’s sovereign AI dreams
snippet: As India accelerates efforts to build a sovereign AI stack, a dozen startups and institutions backed by the government’s IndiaAI Mission are preparing to launch indigenous foundation models. Many of these launches are timed around the India AI Impact Summit next month.

title: China is investigating Meta's latest AI acquisition
snippet: China is investigating whether Meta's acquisition of the artificial intelligence startup Manus violated its laws on technology exports and outbound investment. Those rules say that the Chinese government must approve the export of certain technologies, including interactive AI systems.

title: EU orders X to keep Grok documents for longer amid sexualised AI photos furore
snippet: The EU executive on Thursday said it ordered Elon Musk's Grok to keep data related to the AI chatbot after the tool sparked a backlash for generating sexualised deepfakes of minors. The order means the EU executive can ask X for access to the documents as it looks into the platform and Grok.

title: UK tightens law for tech firms to proactively block 'cyberflashing'
snippet: Dating apps and social media platforms must now pro-actively block "cyberflashing", or unsolicited crude imagery, as the UK clamped down on such activity as a priority offence under the Online Safety Act from Thursday.
